website_summaries.verdict: The ultra-tiny Unihertz Jelly Pro is a fun novelty device, but it can't in any way compete with full-size phones.
pros: Works surprisingly well for its size

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic phone. Everything a full size phone has to ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic phone. Everything a full size phone has to offer in a tiny package. Takes a minute to adjust to typing on a tiny screen but key board works well. Battery will last all day if you don't run location sercives and aren't addicted to Facebook. No complaints here. F$#@ apple
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Baranoski

customer_reviews.title: Great small Android phone for cycling navigation
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this small Android phone as a bike computer with the Amazon CycleBike Smart navigation app.Even though the Unihertz Jelly only uses Navstar GPS satellites (not GLONASS) the track accuracy is very good. The display is adequate to show turn-by-turn directions, and speed, distance and other Bluetooth sensor information using the CycleBike Smart app. The keyboard is very small, but the app doesn't need much user input. Using this phone for general purpose web browsing, texting or email would be tedious.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone I use for Skip the Dishes and morning commutes. my big fingers have a hard time at times and very occasionally the screen doesn't register touches. My only complaint is battery life. Might make 2 hours from full charge at dimmest screen setting using G4 and GPS for delivering. I use a backup battery attached at all times. Phone may last about 8 hours with NO use when left on. Handsfree software malfunctions a little but I havent had any smartphone work especially well handsfree. Great phone for short term use - don't count on it for a day long hike if you aren't going to keep it off until needed.
customer_reviews.author: Happyreigndeer

customer_reviews.title: Cutest thing EVER... awful battery.
customer_reviews.text: How much do I love this tiny phone? It's amazingly adorable and fully functional. Does everything a bigger smartphone does. BUT... after a few days' honeymoon period when everything was fine, the battery sort of "gave up" and would go from 100% to 0% in 2-3 hours -- without me using the phone AT ALL, for ANYTHING, and with the GPS off, the "battery saving" on, and all other settings set to optimize battery life. That won't work under any circumstances. So, I had to return it. I was really sad. If and they improve the battery life, I will buy another one because it is truly adorable and fully functional.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Works with almost any app but just be careful of battery!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall great device if you don't really go on the internet a lot or to use it as a backup. Just make sure you check the battery life all the time because even with the battery saving features, it will still last about a day with no use.
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Neat little phone.
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat little phone. There is a lot packed into it. The build quality isn't the greatest. The down volume button on my unit rocks back and forth a bit. It also doesn't protrude out of the phone as much as the volume up button but it works. The battery cover is really tough to remove the first few times. Once you get the hang of it, it becomes easier to remove. My unit included a guitar pick shaped tool to help you remove the battery cover. I think it's a newer addition as many youtube review videos make no mention of it or show it in un-boxings. Still a neat little phone.
customer_reviews.author: sjpro

customer_reviews.title: Great size but not a good phone
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small phone that would easily fit in my pocket and this was the perfect size. However I ended up returning it for a few reasons: - Battery life was terrible, even after doing everything possible to minimize battery drain. - Phone service was poor. A different phone using the same sim card got much better service. In some cases the Jelly phone got no service at all when the other phone works just fine. - The touch screen was spotty. The touch sensitivity at the bottom of the screen was poor. I regularly had to tap several times to get it to register. This happened in several different apps.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Great for Audible books!!
customer_reviews.text: I have to post a caveat - I am not using this phone as a phone but rather as a device to listen to music and audible books with using blue tooth ear buds. It is small enough to fit in my pocket - unlike my every day phone - so I can slip it in my pocket and go for walks without having to worry about it falling out. I also can use it to read email if I want but I have not downloaded any other apps. It is absolutely perfect for what I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stotler

customer_reviews.title: Smallest Android Smartphone
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an easy to use, very small smartphone that I could just carry in my pocket without really knowing it was there. This Jelly Pro does exactly that. It's loud enough to hear the ring and alerts, etc, and the display is sharp. I couldn't believe that this phone actually existed. It does everything a larger smartphone does. It even has face recognition, but doesn't have the fingerprint sensor. It is really, really a great product.
customer_reviews.author: RAMZ711

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I've since upgraded to the Atom, and if you're thinking of buying the jelly pro, I'd recommend buying the atom instead. The battery in the atom is twice the size, the internal storage is larger, it's waterproof, all around it's an improvement on the Jelly pro. That said, there's nothing inherently wrong with the Jelly pro. It's snappy, lightweight, small, touchscreen is responsive and accurate. It's a good device. My main complaint about it is the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: All the features, great battery, but mini
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this phone to call us on an internet app from Eastern Europe, on the subway, in motion, and we can still hear him. It literally is a tiny iPhone style that disappears in your pocket. Battery is now 2 years old. We bought a replacement, but he doesn’t need it, yet. I was very, very surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The battery REALLY IS THAT BAD.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so badly for it to work; the form factor is great and the touch screen is amazingly, crazily accurate. But the battery would run down from full-charge to nothing in four hours with nothing on but the wireless cell connection. There's a 'newer version' out but it doesn't have a headphone jack, which is a dealbreaker for me. Even without that, the fact that the company even keeps selling this model as a functional phone (which, as sold, it is not) rather than pulling them or selling with an improved battery from the get-go, makes me leery of buying from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Awful Battery life
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is awful. I gave the two stars for the idea and a good built. I wish you had a better choice of battery and processor for this phone. MediaTek processors have one of the worst power management and over that this phone has a small battery. overall I did not have a good experience with this product
customer_reviews.author: Venkat

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little phone
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little phone! I love that it feels like a truly "mobile" phone rather than a large slab of metal and glass. I used it for a month and a half but only got around 8 hours of battery life from it which was the main motivation to switching back to my old phone. I'm keeping this as a backup in case my phone breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Prough

customer_reviews.title: Weak Battery, Bad Background Services, But Strong at the Price
customer_reviews.text: It's good enough that I'm still using it as my daily driver, but not so good that I'd buy it again. The battery life and the fact that it consistently fails to deliver incoming texts in a timely fashion make it pretty annoying. The base keyboard is not really good enough, and the GPS is inaccurate but you won't really use it anyway because it kills the battery too fast. That said, it's good for the price and fun to have a smartphone this small, if only for the comedy.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Love and hate it
customer_reviews.text: It's a good solid phone and having Android 8.1 is great but two major flaws. First, the battery runs down very quickly when being used. The other is the phone app is horrible. It will time out to a blank screen rather quickly and you have to keep turning it back on. This is extremely annoying when trying to navigate a voice menu. Also it should default to my contact list and/or the dialpad. Get rid of the presumption that the last few people called are all I want to see.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Elvis H. Christ

customer_reviews.title: Battery misery
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the phone is great for what I need- it's very compact, the Android system is powerful, and it can do all the things. The one thing it can't do it hold a charge for more than 5 hours. It takes 4-5 hours to charge, and it won't hold over night. Or through the day. If you use it at all, the battery drops ridiculously fast, requiring it to be charged most of a day in order to be used for 40 minutes. I think it's a software problem because the power consumption settings say that 30% of the total energy is constantly directed to the screen. Until that issue gets resolved, I'm not a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenia Nilson

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome device: perfect for a student phone
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome device: perfect for a student phone: forces them not to use too much screen time, but at the same time, actually runs all Android apps. The UI scales surprisingly well. The only issue is that the keyboard is tiny enough to sometimes cause issues if you are pressing keys at an angle to the screen, but if you press vertically, it works fine even if you have large hands.

customer_reviews.text: Phone was okay until Unihertz pushed a software update last week. My phone is now totally bricked. The power light won't even come on when plugged in and the USB port is not recognized by my desktop so not able to reflash the ROM. No customer support from Unihertz after they destroyed my phone.Can't recommend this phone as a result of this failed software update.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Spoilers: Doesn't work on Verizon
customer_reviews.text: I bought for myself, but I have Verizon... which the Jelly doesn't work with :( However, my friend also needed a new phone, so this worked out. He is using it and he really likes it. I do too. Simple, no bloatware. It fits in your damn pockets. Any pocket, including unreasonably small lady pockets *swoon*. I am truly hoping 1) they either expand into more networks and I can then buy this phone or 2) other brands take note and realize there's at least a market for a smaller phone. This one is tiny. Perhaps a little impractically, but I want smaller phones!
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Battery complaints read here:
customer_reviews.text: I'm still evaluating the product, having purchased it on my own (no promo). It must be noted, that someones use dictates the "off charger" use. I have specifically found that using WiFi, will make the battery last about 2-3 hours... if WiFi is off, I have had the phone overnight and then some. In other words, if used as a phone - you'd probably be very satisfied... So WiFi usage is a neg, one more: there seems to be some "refresh" issues with some apps (IE: textnow) as messages are missed. And MMS on TMO seem to be in-configurable (you won't receive dependably or at all). I'll edit or update as I go.
customer_reviews.author: akaBuck

customer_reviews.title: True Genius!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone thinking I could buy back my time, and low and behold I have. I did not want to be tied down to an electronic device. Now I have the best of both worlds, no social media of any kind, but have access to a smartphone with all of its bells and whistles. I can talk, text and use the apps just like a full-size phone. But I do not feel the need to look at it every five seconds. Genius product ever!
customer_reviews.author: Henrietta L. Thies

customer_reviews.title: Great, super small Android phone, terrible battery
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of this phone. It does what it's supposed to do, which is make/receive calls, pair with my Bluetooth headphones, and sync my contacts with the Android os. I don't care about games, texting, email, or anything else. It's super small and light. However, as others have stated, the battery is a trash. It's almost a joke how bad it is. If you do NOTHING, maybe you'll get 4hrs. If you make a few calls, maybe 3? If you do anything else? 2 hours. Not an exaggeration. The battery is awful. But if you can deal with that (it's fine for the way I use it), add a star.
customer_reviews.author: dlcohen

customer_reviews.title: Cute phone bad battery life
customer_reviews.text: This phone is aesthetically pleasing and really small it's comfortable in the hand but the battery life is terrible I was only able to get about 1 hour and 15 minutes on a full charge and the screen is not very responsive sometimes I will have to tap two or three times for it to register it's also very weak will always crash on apps that works fine on all my other phones doesn't even run Google maps without crashing completely pointless for my job
customer_reviews.author: Thinh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is awful!!
customer_reviews.text: These phones were going to be used for my children, to keep a close eye on them as well as have a way to get ahold of them. I used them with google family link. It worked great with any app I downloaded. Truly a mini SMARTPHONE. The one and only fault is the deception on the battery life. The batteries didn't even last half of the school day. Now I'm stuck with the 2 most expensive paperweights.
customer_reviews.author: Ksprite

customer_reviews.title: For the woke folk
customer_reviews.text: Good for controlling technology addiction. Smart phones are making us stupid, and this is a good little tool because you can still communicate with all the annoying people you talk to everyday on snapchat and instagram, but small enough to make typing unnecessary words a hassle which makes you spend less time elaborating and more time talking to people in real life. I like it because im tryna not use my cell phone all the time and this phone is perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Roronoa Zoro

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is terrible
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute phone that can run most of the apps I require. However the battery life is terrible. The phone just sitting will eat the battery to zero in about 11 hours. This is in ideal conditions where no apps are in uses, no inbound or outbound calls, and wifi access is constant (no wifi searching by the phone). I wouldn't want to be out and about using this phone without quick access to a power source.
customer_reviews.author: Fogged

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect. Battery life needs to be improved.
customer_reviews.text: I only used it for a couple of days but I like it for what it is. The phone is simply beautiful and the size is perfect. Only problem with mine is that when I put the brightness in the lowest setting the brightness doesn’t stay where it is and it goes up and down. I don’t know what’s the problem with it. The phone would be perfect for me if it had a decent battery life. I am trying to make it last a whole day if I can’t I’ll go back to my IPhone SE
customer_reviews.author: Santiago R.

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Otherwise somewhat like the phone, although the tiny keyboard makes me much more careful when sending messages. Battery life is a big problem. Camera is also terrible but I don't use it much. Might return if I don't find a solution.
customer_reviews.author: ormond

customer_reviews.title: This phone stopped working after two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: While the size and capacity are fine, the actual phone function stopped working after two weeks. The online manufacturer's chat told me "we fixed that problem" and asked me to check the phone's build. I had what they had supposedly fixed. Both speaker and microphone are full of static; they were bad but usable on the first day, but some 12 days later are completely unusable. Conversations are impossible to hear. Expensive junk.
customer_reviews.author: coco

customer_reviews.title: A great little phone with only one problem.
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can see, this is a great phone with one BIG drawback -- when on a call, the keypad disappears and cannot be called up again! For example, when I call my pharmacy and the store says 'Press 2 to continue" , well, good luck! So, for everything excepting using it as a phone, this phone is great!?! Sad.
customer_reviews.author: nytowl

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: The phone seemed quite good for a while but the screen stopped responding after only 9 months. I generally have devices like this for several years. This is pretty sad.
